intro: Prismatomeris fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant prismatomeris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
